n8n is a source-available low-code workflow automation tool. This Appsmith project extends n8n dashboard and provides a more structured overview of the workflows, their basic characteristics, and past executions. On top of that, it allows generating draft workflow documentation in just a single mouse click. Note: The dashboard contains referral links to the n8n website. Consider keeping and using these links ‚Äî it helps the development of this free tool. Your support is greatly appreciated! üòä

How to Use this Dashboard

  • Upon first load, a modal window will appear requesting dashboard configurations.
  • Enter the n8n API key and your n8n instance URL, then press Confirm to start loading the data.
  • Press Reset top menu item to clear the configuration data.

Dashboard Overview

The top middle section contains three buttons that allow for the selection of all workflows, only active workflows, or only those with recent execution history. The main table provides a general overview of the workflows. Click on the URL icon to navigate directly to the individual workflow on your n8n instance.

üìã Overview Pane

The default view is the Overview pane. When you click on a workflow with an execution history, a chart displaying the duration of each recent workflow execution will appear beneath the main table. Successful and failed executions are color-coded according to your app theme. Click on an individual bar to access the workflow history screen in your n8n instance

‚úíÔ∏è Docs Pane

Click on the Docs Pane to access the workflow documentation features. This pane includes the following elements beneath the main table:
  • A rich text editor for workflow documentation;
  • A panel displaying workflow metrics;
  • Two buttons that leverage GPT-4 to assist in writing workflow documentation;
  • A download button for saving your documentation.
Select a workflow to view its metrics. Click on the Node Type to open a new window with node information on the n8n website. Once a workflow is selected, clicking the Brief or Detailed description button will generate a draft of documentation within the rich text editor. You may edit this draft before downloading. Ensure that you have made at least one edit to enable the download of a valid HTML document.
